intro: Edithea oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Oaxaca, Mexico. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
